name: TheAtlantic
text: The Supreme Court's ruling on abortion rights is a sign that it cannot be rapidly transformed to meet Trump's political needs, @emmaogreen reports. https://t.co/4nmlUeFUFw

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Maybe it’s time to let go of the hurt, angry teenager you used to be, and get to know the compassionate and open-minded adult he’s becoming." @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader who is struggling to navigate his father’s remarriage: https://t.co/0FuJQIqBau

name: TheAtlantic
text: .@JamesFallows looks at the disaster of America's pandemic response, in the form of an NTSB report: “This was a journey straight into a mountainside, with countless missed opportunities to turn away.” https://t.co/YLbKGAs4lB

name: TheAtlantic
text: Yesterday's BET Awards had the task of celebrating black culture while also reckoning with the pandemic and systemic violence against black people. @shirklesxp reports on the work that led to the show's success: https://t.co/j8Y1drwbvd

name: TheAtlantic
text: In a 5-4 vote, the Supreme Court struck down a Louisiana law that would require abortion doctors to have admitting privileges at a nearby hospital. What the case really spoke to, one expert told Emma Green, is "whether the Court is committed to precedent.” https://t.co/UcDEx1BsIk

name: TheAtlantic
text: The president is leading this country through a pandemic while also running for reelection. And he’s stumbling on both fronts. The latest Atlantic Daily, from @mimbsy: https://t.co/VVVjE48UhH

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YAppelbaum: Biden has opened up a wide lead over Trump in the polls. So why are some white voters abandoning Trump? Maybe not for the reason you’d think:

https://t.co/s7f6soozI8

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “Nobody jumped in, either to agree with the president or to challenge him. Nobody in the room suggested to him that praising Confederate generals was inappropriate for a president under any circumstances, especially after all that had just taken place.” https://t.co/sE5fbx5BnK

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: I wrote about November: https://t.co/rIttDtR24j

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: Amazing.

"The president, sitting there at the table Grant used, declared Lee 'the greatest strategic military mind perhaps ever.' He also praised the Confederate general Stonewall Jackson."

From a new piece by @jonkarl (via @TheAtlantic):
https://t.co/GSI5iTY1VR

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Being ignorable, tedious, and boring is the kiss of death for a politician like Trump. If he has made a central promise to his supporters—and to the public at large—it is to entertain. Now he is violating that commitment." -- @qjurecic and @benjaminwittes
https://t.co/xqTkZBYxH3

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump’s instincts about the presidency rely pervasively on the idea that the president should be entertaining. The country, in Trump’s view, needs to be constantly transfixed on the president," @qjurecic and @benjaminwittes write: https://t.co/JCgGGjRJ8l

name: TheAtlantic
text: "To take a full accounting of Donald Trump’s corrosive effect on our politics, you need to look at his enemies," Andrew Ferguson writes: https://t.co/R1uFOOgcKw

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The driving factor for Trump’s collapse appears to be race," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/9tUDHbdReL
